verses.verse: (1 Sam. 2:5; Is. 54:1) He grants the barren woman a home, Like a joyful mother of children. Praise the LORD!
The Power of God in His Deliverance of Israel When (Ex. 12:51; 13:3) Israel went out of Egypt, The house of Jacob (Ps. 81:5) from a people of strange language,
(Ex. 6:7; 19:6; 25:8; 29:45, 46; Deut. 27:9) Judah became His sanctuary, And Israel His dominion.
(Ex. 14:21; Ps. 77:16) The sea saw it and fled; (Josh. 3:13-16) Jordan turned back.
(Ex. 19:18; Judg. 5:5; Ps. 29:6; Hab. 3:6) The mountains skipped like rams, The little hills like lambs.
(Hab. 3:8) What ails you, O sea, that you fled? O Jordan, that you turned back?
O mountains, that you skipped like rams? O little hills, like lambs?
Tremble, O earth, at the presence of the Lord, At the presence of the God of Jacob,
(Ex. 17:6; Num. 20:11; Ps. 107:35) Who turned the rock into a pool of water, The flint into a fountain of waters.
The Futility of Idols and the Trustworthiness of God Not ((Is. 48:11); Ezek. 36:32) unto us, O LORD, not unto us, But to Your name give glory, Because of Your mercy, Because of Your truth.
Why should the Gentiles say, (Ps. 42:3, 10) “So where is their God?”
((1 Chr. 16:26)) But our God is in heaven; He does whatever He pleases.
(Deut. 4:28; 2 Kin. 19:18; Is. 37:19; 44:10, 20; Jer. 10:3) Their idols are silver and gold, The work of men’s hands.
They have mouths, but they do not speak; Eyes they have, but they do not see;
They have ears, but they do not hear; Noses they have, but they do not smell;
They have hands, but they do not handle; Feet they have, but they do not walk; Nor do they mutter through their throat.
(Ps. 135:18; Is. 44:9-11) Those who make them are like them; So is everyone who trusts in them.
(Ps. 118:2, 3) O Israel, trust in the LORD; (Ps. 33:20) He is their help and their shield.
